meanings.definition: Operated by a machine or machinery
meanings.sent1: The mechanical toy moved on its own.
meanings.sent2: The factory had many mechanical devices to help with production.
meanings.sent3: The mechanical clock seemed to have a mind of its own, chiming at odd hours.
meanings.sent4: Her response was mechanical, as if she was just going through the motions.
meanings.sent5: The mechanical whirring of the engine filled the room.

meanings.sent1: He had a deep understanding of mechanical systems.
meanings.sent2: The mechanical engineer designed a new type of gearbox.
meanings.sent3: The mechanical problems in the old car made it sound like a symphony of clunks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a well-oiled mechanical device, always efficient.
meanings.sent5: The mechanical parts of the clock gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Done as if by a machine; automatic
meanings.sent1: His response was so mechanical, it was like he was on autopilot.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive task became almost mechanical after a while.
meanings.sent3: The mechanical way she recited the poem made it lose its charm.
meanings.sent4: His movements were mechanical, lacking any human touch.
meanings.sent5: The mechanical routine of the daily commute numbed his mind.
